column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Ms.
#Text=Rossignol (France) (spoke in French): Allow\r
#Text=me to begin by thanking the Secretary-General,\r
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Kevin Hyland, Mr.
#Text=Yury Fedotov and Ms.
#Text=Ilwad\r
#Text=Elman for their briefings.
#Text=France associates itself with the statement to be\r
#Text=delivered by the observer of the European Union.
#Text=The actions committed by Da'esh in the Middle\r
#Text=East and by Boko Haram in Africa are a dramatic\r
#Text=illustration of the links that exist today between\r
#Text=threats to international peace and security and human\r
#Text=trafficking.
#Text=At the global level, trafficking in persons\r
#Text=and trafficking in drugs and counterfeit currency are\r
#Text=among the most profitable.
#Text=Their annual profits are\r
#Text=estimated at $32 billion.
#Text=It is one of the most extensive\r
#Text=forms of trafficking.
#Text=Sexual exploitation, forced\r
#Text=labour, servitude, kidnapping for forced prostitution,\r
#Text=rape - the list of atrocities committed in armed\r
#Text=conflict is, unfortunately, long.
#Text=Deriving profits from\r
#Text=human beings and considering them as merchandise,\r
#Text=the traffickers, as well as consumers and users and\r
#Text=the clients of sexual exploitation, clearly and brutally\r
#Text=violate their victims' human rights and further stoke\r
#Text=the causes of conflict.
#Text=The international community has invested heavily\r
#Text=in this problem since the beginning of this century,\r
#Text=but further efforts are needed in order to address the\r
#Text=scourge of human trafficking.
#Text=I therefore welcome the\r
#Text=initiative of the United Kingdom during its presidency\r
#Text=of the Security Council and thank that country for\r
#Text=giving us this opportunity to have an exchange on this\r
#Text=very important subject.
#Text=For France, the issue oftrafficking in human beings\r
#Text=and slavery, especially that of women and children, is\r
#Text=of major importance.
#Text=The statistics are, unfortunately,\r
#Text=well known, but we must constantly point them out:\r
#Text=80 per cent of the victims of trafficking are women\r
#Text=and children.
#Text=The challenges are also well known:\r
#Text=the identification of victims is still in its infancy, and\r
#Text=organized mechanisms for fighting this scourge vary\r
#Text=greatly between countries.
#Text=Despite progress since the\r
#Text=entry into force of the Palermo Protocol to Prevent,\r
#Text=Suppress and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially\r
#Text=Women and Children, still too few prosecutions have\r
#Text=been initiated in cases involving the crime of human\r
#Text=trafficking.
#Text=The victims themselves do not always assert\r
#Text=their rights and very often are insufficiently protected.
#Text=In that context, international cooperation must be\r
#Text=stepped up so as to increase the geographic coverage\r
#Text=of the legislation providing effective protection against\r
#Text=networks and to improve international cooperation\r
#Text=aimed at dismantling those networks.
#Text=Prevention,\r
#Text=protection and the fight against impunity are the three\r
#Text=priorities of French diplomacy in the fight against\r
#Text=trafficking in human beings.
#Text=Since human trafficking is now an integral part\r
#Text=of the strategy of certain terrorist groups and it fuels\r
#Text=transnational organized crime, the Security Council\r
#Text=has a special responsibility in combating this scourge.
#Text=The adoption of resolution 2331 (2016), last December,\r
#Text=at the initiative of Spain, was a major step forward\r
#Text=towards better addressing the link between trafficking\r
#Text=in human beings, sexual violence and terrorism.
#Text=France\r
#Text=very much looks forward to the report to be prepared by\r
#Text=the Secretary-General by the end of the year.
#Text=We have in place a robust international legal\r
#Text=framework and appropriate tools, in particular the\r
#Text=United Nations Convention against Transnational\r
#Text=Organized Crime and its Protocols and the United\r
#Text=Nations Office on Drugs and Crime, which is doing\r
#Text=sterling work in this field.
#Text=On International Women's Rights Day, the President\r
#Text=of the French Republic also announced that France\r
#Text=would propose an additional protocol to the Convention\r
#Text=for the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination\r
#Text=against Women.
#Text=That protocol would address violence\r
#Text=against women in order to complement the existing\r
#Text=international framework.
#Text=But we must ensure that\r
#Text=the obligations arising from that legal framework are\r
#Text=effectively implemented.
#Text=Our words must now be\r
#Text=translated into action.
#Text=Rest assured, Mr.
#Text=President, that France will\r
#Text=continue to play its full part in those efforts.
